Kris Zyp wrote:

> Certainly one of the key differences between JSON and XML is that in
> XML elements are simply named, but they don't define any relationship
> between child and parent. In JSON, it is exactly the opposite,
> property names are defining relationships between values rather than
> naming values. 

How, exactly does JSON's grammar do this that holds true for all JSON 
formatted data? I don't get it.

Bill
